comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC: Bain's caption reads "Federals," not "Feds." The Mexican troops were not called "Feds."

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo of Mexican federal troops at Torreon:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/5209398700/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
By Bain's serial numbers these two pictures are a secuence.  It seems (3028-4) General José Refugio Velasco is passing review to the troops,  most likely before fleeing from Torreón towards San Pedro de las Colonias.  and 3028-5 they are marching on to that Town.  Although they fled by train on the first  3 days of Aplil 1914.  The other possiblility is the arrival to San Pedro.
Dr. Roberto Duarte
